intro: Ardisia lucidula, commonly known as the shining evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are bright red berries that contain several seeds. Ardisia lucidula is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
